review: My step-daughter and three grandsons took me to TGI Friday's for lunch.  It was my first and last time there.  It took more than an hour from the time orders were placed until food began to arrive.  Several of the entrees were tepid or cold.  I had the Mahi-Mahi and Shrimp.  Both were dried out and tough.  Also everything had a peppery bite to it.  Is the pepper a distraction so one doesn't notice the other inadequacies of the food?  I now understand why, on a sunny but cold Saturday only about a quarter of the tables were occupied.  TGIF or otherwise, I won't return to the chain.
Slowest service in the Lehigh Valley - one hour to get our meal and it had been under the lights for who-knows-how-long. Sub-par. Last time we will go here.

terrible service!! i was in town on saturday, july 29th for a huge family trip to dorney park. we all drove down from md. After pouring all day we wanted food it was 13 of us waiting for a table. It took about 20 minutes. The first table we got was in a corner with no space to move, it was literally a box, the hostess didnt set up the table with menus, i did!! We were moved shortly after telling them there was no room. Finally, we get to a new table, it took our server 15 min to greet us with an attitude, he took our drink orders and we asked to put in our apps and he said no that he would come back so he could be organized. well he must of went on a smoke break because it took him 20 MINUTES TO RETURN WITH DRINKS!! we then got up and left. we spoke to the manager and he said "well the drinks are there now!" and didnt offer any service or anything!! the place is slow and horrible!
Avg at best food was nothing to brag about chicken app that I had was over cooked customer service was excellent thou but that was the best thing they had going

This was my first time here in a while. I used the front of the line pass so we didn't have to wait for a table. I thought that was pretty neat. We decided to get a bar high top table. It worked out, my son (6) really enjoed the huge tvs and liked the big stools.  What I didn't like was the huge smudge/ sticky substance on my wine glass. I sent it back, they poured the same wine in a new glass. Came out just as dirty. (Pictures attached)  the appetizer was delicious, try the garlic bruschetta if possible. Prime rib sandwich was also very good. My son got the kids ribs and ate each of them. Our waitress never checked on us and that was very annoying. The restaurant was swamped though. I didn't understand why she had to take my phone to print off a coupon....  Also we noticed a lot of tables were dirty, it's like all the bussers were nowhere to be seen.

Stopped for a quick meal with our family on a Wednesday night. Restaurant was empty. Took 52 minutes for 2 entrees and a kids meal. Food arrived barely warm. Pasta was too dried out and crunchy to eat. After attempting a few bites, I rearranged the slices of chicken on my plate and noticed the pink uncooked center. I don't generally choose this place, even though it's close to everything. Now I most certainly won't.

We didn't see our waitress for the first 15 minutes after being seated. She came over flustered as if we had been thrown on her (a table of five plus one infant.) Our drinks took another 15 minutes or more to arrive. It was like that all evening long.  She brought out chips and salsa a very long time after we were seated, an appetizer was completely forgotten, and the food came out cold.  The food was ok and our party seemed otherwise satisfied with it. Nothing monumental for burgers, steak, pasta, chicken, and fish.  I don't recommend this location.

Family dinner eat out its been a long time I haven't had their foods! We wore dissatisfied,portions are small,an expensive what a ripoff never again! We waited 10 min. For us to be sitted 15 tables where available two idiots in the front don't know how to run the show!this place sucks and
Slow service not to mention the 1 hr wait time on Mother's Day yet with several tables open. Management is horrible at seating this location was at half capacity, no reason why people had to wait.

Was there Friday 5/12/17, place was packed. Got there at 7pm, After 15 minute wait(not bad), we were sat. Our server said the kitchen was jacked up tonight and expect a wait for food.  So we order a water and a iced tea.  After 15-20 minutes drinks came. Server then pointed out she try to get our food but, she said people are walking out, because the kitchen is still backed up. So we order sandwiches.  We see other tables getting appetizers brought with apologies. 7:45 still no sign of food and the restaurant is about 1/2 full. We ask whats up, server says trying to get our food, 8:00 pm I go to the hostess station to find 3 young ladies texting on their phones and having a good time. I ask to speak to the manager, she shows up 5 minutes later, I complain she apologizes but really doesn't seem concerned. Just total joke, by 8:15pm we leave in disgust. Definitely would not got back, maybe it was unique to that night, but when I emailed corporate, my return emails was.... We're sorry for your bad experience and that they value my input so they can better their service. And have good day.. That was discouraging also... Thanks for nothing TGI Fridays

Mahi mahi fish was VERY good. I liked steamed broccoli, Parmesan steak fries and chicken salad sandwich. Didn't care much for Tennessee Whiskey cake or regular fries or avocado vinaigrette dressing. Burger was very good first time I tried it, not so much the second time. As far as service, it's hit or miss.
Cherry limeade was good. So was the ribeye steak with Langoatino lobster topping. The only issue was that the steak seemed to have a bit too much fat. For a 10 oz, I expected a bit more meat.

The best part about this trip to Friday's was the unlimited appetizers, and that's about it. Our server was difficult to flag down and service, especially to start, was very slow, but she was good about replacing our waters and refilling our appetizers.  We ordered:  1. Potstickers: The sauce is sweet and interesting (definitely not Szechuan), but the potstickers themselves are bland with strange textures that definitely don't belong in a potsticker.  2. Loaded potato skins: I love these, but even I have to admit that we seemed to be getting a bad batch here. Excessively oily, and one of our potato skins had a huge black portion at the bottom (had it gone bad? I honestly don't know).  3. Boneless buffalo wings: these were particularly bad, even for T. G. I. Friday's - our second plate was half the normal size, and half shards of chicken encased in a completely disproportionate amount of breading.  Overall, if I go back, it will be because I'm starving and I'm planning to eat at least fifteen potato skins.
Wow...half the menu consists of burgers and they're completely out of burgers. Manager didn't have any accommodations for their lack of poor planning. Very disappointing!

Disappointing... this place is just never consistent. I've been here 3 times in the last 6 months and only once could I say it was good. Having to wait 20 min for someone to acknowledge you at a table for service and another 20 min to get a check is unacceptable. This place is not worth the aggravation... I don't plan to come back here.

Service at fridays is steadily going down hill. I am noticing a trend in quality from multiple locations.  The food was acceptable, i ordered the endless appetizer. Some of my apps came out burnt, that is when the bartender AMANDA finally put my orders in. Also a terrible blend of my cooler cosmo, definitely showed little effort. The manager did comp my meal after i had to get a server to take my order and while paying encountered another rude comment from Amanda.  Will never be back!!
We came in for "Endless Apps". They took 15-20 minutes to get us our app refills after we ordered them.  Very slow for a place that was only at half-capacity.

So gross. The place was really slow, yet really dirty. Stay away from the smoke stack burger. Just taste like grease. No flavor of any kind, just grease. The prices are getting way outta hand too. Like $12 for an appetizer, $8 for dessert. The chicken and cheese which was always a safe bet, went up to $16. It's a piece of chicken and some mashed potatoes!?!?! I will never come here again.

I came here with several friends. I ordered a pecan chicken salad. Salad tasted just fine. A friend ordered the bruschetta chicken pasta which came dry. Girlfriend ordered the Jack Daniels ribs with a side of Mac n cheese. She got mashed potatoes instead of the Mac n cheese. We ordered an app which we never got. When telling the waitress about this, in a respectful manner, she rolled her eyes at us when walking away, thinking we wouldn't see it. When she came back, we asked for a manager. He gave us 50% off our order but didn't seem to care.  A lady who was the supervisor Saturday nights came to our table and asked how things were. We told here they were terrible. She seemed to care more than the manager and waitress about our terrible experience. The day after, I felt terrible, as well as our friend who also ordered chicken. I can't think of anything aside from the chicken that would have given me stomach problems. I do not intend on coming back here.

josh is a 10/10 5 stars. if u don't go when josh is there then u might as well leave, he'll tell you that his name is josh, but we know it's george. believe me. JOSH BETTER GET PROMOTED SOON also shout out to Jenny for being our wingwoman and introducing us to the gorgeous creature that is Josh. he made 4 new best friends today, we have formed the club TGI-Josh. LIVE LOVE JOSH

Just like any other joint around the area, but I think the service was great. I kept making our waitress get things so thumbs up and she was nice about everything. Food was mediocre, nothing fancy.  Great for lunch.

Went here for lunch break from work. Terrible service. The waitress, Cindy was rude. There weren't even many table sat when we came in. Ordered the harvest salad, which barely had anything on it. It was just a bed of lettuce with chicken on top. What a disappointment.

Dump, first walked in asking what the wait time would be. Only thing answer I received as place move to the side I have others to seat. Thanks for the no answer. After sitting for 45 mins we finally got drink and well I know a jack and coke is something hard to make. Well it was a Jim and coke. Food was cold and crap. Do not eat there. Staff is trash.

My friend and I went last Wednesday May 28th to this location at approx 2:15PM. We walked in and were greeted promptly and were seated immediately due to the time of day.  The restaurant was empty to the exception of a few tables. The greeter gave us menu's and told us the server would be right over.   I remember it was around 2:15 PM because my friend asked me what tie it was when we were seated.  We chose what we were wanting to eat and sat waiting for the server.  And waited.  And waited.   Time is now 2:25PM  Viewed a man looking around like he was searching for his server.  Flagged down greeter who sat us and asked her to find a server since we had been waiting. She said she would. During the entire time we were waiting we heard copious amounts of laughter and roughhousing in the kitchen area.  Time is now 2:30PM and we stood up and walked out the door.  SUMMERY : fifteen minutes of waiting for our server in a close to empty restaurant while listening to what seemed like a crazy gossip session going on in the kitchen area and watching another customer searching in vain for his server did not leave the favorable impression that Friday's wants in a Yelp review.  I noticed a decal on the door as we were walking in about reviewing our restaurant visit on Yelp.  Well here's my review Fridays, I'm sorry but you earned this bad a rating from me.  Will there be a next time?  After this experience, I highly doubt it.

I'm not a huge chain restaurant person, but on occasion, I just want a cheap drink & appetizer and places like TGI Friday's certainly fit the bill. This location has a HUGE bar.  Even when they are busy I've been able to find a seat.  Drinks are okay (a little sweeter than I'd prefer), and the appetizers are large enough to share as a meal if you aren't starved (we often share potato skins & boneless wings).  I also like the club sandwich.  Bartenders are friendly but sometimes overworked (the huge bar normally isn't staffed as well as it should be).  Lots of TVs so easy to catch any game.  Don't forget to sign up for the Stripes program...who doesn't like a free item every once in a while!
Great place to stop after a tiring day at Dorney Park. We had a great server named Jason and the food came out fast and everything was delicious!

We live near this establishment and have not been here in awhile.  After waiting for a table for 25 min and seeing plenty were available, I realized why we hadn't been there in awhile.  Our server was not much better. Took us 20 min to order food after being seated. I watched as she took two other tables orders went to the computer entered those and then got another table some drinks. We had two children w us. (4yr and 1yr old). Both were patient but our appetizer came out at the same time of our meals.  Our server never chked for drink refills and when we were finally done she came. I handed her the credit card and said just give me the bill. Not knowing the next time she would show up.  They gave us coupons for a free dessert next time, we had no desire to stick around for a comp dessert for the error w the appetizer.  We do not plan on returning. The service was reckless.

Bad service at the bar. Food was average at best and overpriced. Very out dated bathrooms. Not a fun "Fridays" atmosphere that you can find in other locations. Should have known when we walked in on a Saturday afternoon and it was empty. Don't waste your time, money or appetite.

Horrible, horrible, horrible. Gave it one star because our waitress was very sweet and attentive and deserves a good word here but otherwise do not waste your money.   We started with the BBQ chicken flatbread appetizer - are you kidding me! Almost $11 for that? BBQ sauce with tiny pieces of chicken. I could've made that for a few dollars - bad. We ordered the Jack Daniels chicken sandwich - supposed to be basted in a special JD glaze. Well no - the glaze was on the side and there was maybe one onion straw on the sandwich and it was lukewarm. We also got the California chicken club. Also a poorly made sandwich - don't know where the yogurt aioli was. And nice try with the slab of Gouda on there all cold and gross.  The menu sure made things sound better than they actually are. And for as fast as everything came out, I'm quite sure it came out of a plastic bag and was microwaved to warm it up...barely. All that and fountain drinks for $42. Yep - $42 wasted. I used to love it at TGI Fridays but will never return. Oh - and not to mention the hostess who was very odd and annoying - she just made the visit even more umm interesting. Never again.

To be honest, after checking Yelp reviews for this restaurant, I thought it would be a subpar experience. But it was the closest TGI Friday's to where I was that evening, so I went in anyway. Well, I guess I got them on a good night! Everything went smoothly from start to finish and the server anticipated my needs every step of the way. I didn't really order anything special, just a standard Jack Daniels burger, so it was about what one would expect from the restaurant chain. Overall experience though was above average for the chain, and a bit better than the Quakertown location. As a plus, this restaurant has complimentary WiFi internet with good food-photo-posting bandwidth.

Great if you like an all processed menu selection. Don't bother going here if you have food allergies. They have a separate food sensitivity menu but nothing can be altered as it all processed. Couldn't even order a steak. Wound up with salad but couldn't even have any dressing. Bad choice a all around.
Very good food and drinks but staff is what makes the different especially  Carol. On my visit today she made me and my guess feel special thanks a lot

We have not been here for a while. The service and food was always good as far as i remember. This time it took 10 minutes to get seated at 330 pm on a saturday. The place was empty. The service was very slow. Our apps took 20 minutes and dinner came by 5pm. We were given one half price entree an two free deserts in leu of the wait which was fine. I probably wont be back for a while because of the bad service.

Came here and was a little underwhelmed with the service. The only server who seemed to be on his game was a younger male bartender. We walked in at an odd time (I think it was around 4) and there were only about 7 or 8 tables full. One group walked in ahead of us, and needless to say the hostess panicked and was obviously overmatched. After waiting for a couple minutes twiddling our thumbs, we ended up just moving to the bar. It took forever to get our drink order and food order taken, but I won't hold it against this guy b/c he was the only one behind the bar and  about 60% of the patrons were there...so not only was he personally serving half of the restaurant, but he was making drinks for all the rest of them. Maybe he should give a few pointers to the chick who was overwhelmed by walking 2 sets of people to their seats. The middle-aged female bartender who came and started helping him later was rude. I was staring at a pile of to-go containers on the other side of the bar directly across from me. When I asked her for a container and motioned to them (she could have grabbed them with one hand, and without moving handed them to me...for a sum total of 3 seconds worth of work) she acted annoyed and told me "hold on one minute," then proceeded to walk around and look busy doing a whole lot of nothing for the next 5 minutes before she just completely forgot. Needless to say, the dude who had made about 35 drinks in that time period ended up grabbing us the containers and our check. The food tasted just like TGI Fridays.

If I could give zero stars - I would.  I so wish I had read the reviews on this place before we went in.  We were traveling through the area.  The TGIF near our house is consistent - decent food and pretty quick.  Overall what you expect from a chain. THIS PLACE WAS AWFUL.  One of the worst experiences I've had in a restaurant.  We sat for quite a while before anyone came over.  It was a quiet Sunday afternoon.  Drink order was not too much issue.  F We waited a loooooooong time for the food.  When it came, it was clear that the burger had been sitting under a heat lamp for a long time.  The rock was literally solid.  The burger which had been ordered MR, was a hockey puck.  My wife's chicken salad was the same.  The chicken was rubber from being under the lamp and the lettuce was hot. The kids meals had about 6 fries on the plate.  It was amazing that any server would even think to put those things in front of a customer. We are not complainers - but this was ridiculous.  We sent both back - and the replacements were not too much better - but we just wanted to eat and get out.  The manager came over and apologized - but seemed like he had said the same words 1,000 times.  It was like he was going through the motions - it was clear that he didn't want to be there. Then I respond to the standard survey on the receipt - assuming I'd at least get an email from TGIF recognizing that they heard me.  Nothing.  If you're going to ask to hear from a customer - at least acknowledge what's communicated! This experience makes me very wary of any TGIF location now!

So went for a quick dinner. Just wanted good food hassle free.  All the advertising for this and that so thought the appetizer special would be a good dinner.  After long wait.....placed the order.....yes that is the special, but only for that part of the menu not for what we got. Service was slow even with beverages. The French onion soup was a pour excuse. Anybody that knows me I love a good thing of French onion soup......this was a one.  The burger was better, thus the two star

I can tell you that this is not a place to bring friends or family. Why you ask?  We made a reservation for 8pm and did not get seated until 8:40. Why made reservations in the first place. Well, although the waitress was nice she was not very good. After taking our order she forgot to take the menus and did I say that we had 13 in our party.  I then handed the manager the menus and she did thank me for doing her job. To cut to the chase, orders came out at different times and drink refills were hard to come by.  The staff were having a wonderful conversation  near the bar.  I got up once to get someone to respond to our request.  They were all smiles without one apology.  Still it took forever to complete our dinner and again the staff was nowhere to be found.  Management stood in the front talking and did thank us for coming as we left.  A rather amateurishly run Friday's to say the least. Oh yeah, the food was just ok.

The burger a was a brick, the chicken was chewey. The Mac and cheese didn't equate to Mac and cheese (No cheese flavor). Honestly just go across the street to Cali Burrito. I have never had an experience as bad this at a TGI Fridays.

Just finishing a disappointing lunch. The pecan encrusted chicken salad was terrible. The chicken was dried out, appeared to have freezer burn, the salad was limp. It took forever to get our meals. Not a good experience for a chain that used to be top notch.

Unfortunate that a chain restaurant would produce such a poor dining experience. The bar smelled like moldy beer taps, I was tapped the wrong beer, the fries were way over salted and i think I coulda got a better quality burger patty from the McDonalds drive through. The bartender was semi pleasant but I listened to her tell a patron across the bar that it was the patrons fault she didn't get her side salad before her entree because she ordered incorrectly. I tipped 18% to be polite. Will drive on by to Red Robin next time.

Husband and I went at 2pm on a Monday. The place was pretty empty. We were seated right away and our server was fine. The food is wayyyy overpriced. Me and my husband were shocked when we opened our menus. $11 for a plate of like 8 boneless wings...that's a little much I think. I got the chicken and shrimp, husband got shrimp and fries. The shrimp was a bit over cooked had a slight burned taste. Again small portions for the price they charge. For an app, 2 meals and we had water it was $45. I won't return again just because of the price.

Wish I would've read the reviews before going! Won't be back. My husband was afraid to eat the chicken-it didn't seem done. The Mac and cheese was cold and my Sam Adams Octoberfest went flat in 5 minutes. Sad

Terrible service. Waited my whole meal for a drink. Way overpriced, my food had no taste to it. My sons sliders didn't even taste like meat. The only good things were the appetizers and my older son liked his chicken fingers.

This place is awful!!!! I came here about 2 weeks ago and it was just so terrible. Our server never put in out appetizer order but didn't tell us until our food came out. She didn't even apologize. She just said it was an oversight. Also, my French onion soup was luke warm at best. We had to ask for the check 3 times before receiving it. Will not come back.

We were excited to go to tgi Friday's as my husband and I love the Jack Daniels sauce. We got there and the hostesses were rude. There were three of them up front chatting. Why do you need three hostesses? Then they seat us and bring us a high chair. The high chair was filthy! I had to scrub it with baby wipes. We were seated by the hostesses so they watched me do this and didn't offer to clean it. I would have asked for a different one but the waitress already took 15 minutes to come and acknowledge us. The food was decent but overpriced. We had the Jack Daniels sampler as our appetizer and they didn't give us any plates! Our check was 58$ and it just wasn't worth it. Very displeased.

where do i begin? first it took forever to get seated and it didnt look crowded at all. there were PLENTY of open tables. when we get seated, we ordered and it took 45 mins until out food came. the orders were wrong, my friend had MOLD on her bun, and my food came out after everyone finished their meal. the waitress never checked up on us either. i demanded a gift card and got one. i will not be eating there anymore but ill order to take out with my gift card. this place effing sucks.

I love coming here Friday nights where there is a bartender named Joe. He makes a  pretty bad-ass mojito and margarita. Also is a great listener and has listened to my really horrible stories while I have been intoxicated. Go see Joe!

Lots of fun here tonight.  Lianna is a great server. Did a great job taking care of us. My wife loved her shrimp and the drink she ordered.   Haven't been in here in years and I have to say they've improved a lot. (Although I do kinda miss the flair)

I honestly haven't been to TGI Friday's in 3-4 years. First off I was surprised by how the prices went up! The average appetizer is $10, burger $13 and entree is $15. We arrived early on Saturday night, about 4:00pm. Most of the restaurant was empty and yet the hostess who was clearly confused went back and fourth with another employee as to where to seat us for about 2 minutes. We should've turned around there and left but we stuck it out and got seated. Our waiter who was nice, was also easily confused by us ordering their non-alcoholic slush drinks. When my fiance ordered he replied with "those aren't free refills". The menu states the slushes do have free refills. And we had to point that out to him. We ordered an appetizer, she got chicken fingers and I got a burger. The food was as expected and enjoyable. But sitting through my whole meal without a refill on my or her drink is quite ridiculous. For that reason alone, I won't be back. And now that we gave it a shot while we were in the area, and saw the escalated prices and poor service, we'll be taking our future business elsewhere.

We live near this location and have had good service and good food when we come during slow hours. Food is usually more consistent then the service. We did witness a shift change that got very catty when someone wanted to leave but her station wasn't checked. And she wanted to share it with the world. Drinks are good as well. And a plus, is if you join the rewards program, they give you chips and salsa every trip and it is pretty easy to earn rewards. This is a good place to go if you an in the area but not worth a special stop.

Food took forever to come out, seriously not more than a burger cooked medium, when it came out it was well done and only warm, fries were soggy and sorry looking. Skip this place, may I recommend red Robbin instead!

I had a buy an entree get an entree free coupon so why not - right?  I ordered the sizzling chicken and shrimp.  The chicken was a bit dry and the some of the shrimp did not taste fresh.  The entree came with garlic mashed which I switched for roasted squash which was very good.  The server was the best part of the meal - very attentive!  If I didn't have the freebie coupon, I would have been even more disappointed.  I will think twice about visiting here again.

There were 5 or 6 families or couples waiting to be seated and 7 tables open.  I asked  why we needed to wait 40 minutes to be seated and was told the manager handled all seating arrangements.  The hostess said "those seats are reserved".  I stated I was told in the past Fridays did not accept reservations, then asked to speak with the manager.  David Shankweller (the manager) came to speak with me.  He said those customers were signed in and called on their cell phones and needed to be given time to take their table.  I told him that was bad business and when customers are ready to be served they should be, then left.  I saw 2 other customers come and go in the 5 minutes I was there.  When I asked Mr. Shankweller for his card, he looked and did not have one handy, so he went to get it and came back a couple minutes later.

Came here on a sunday around 8:00 pm, we had two waiters because one was training. We were seated at a table that is right next to the kitchen/bathroom/server station. The waiter training the trainee was kind of rude and forgot my drink and didnt bother coming back until our appatizers arrived. The worst oart about him not coming back to check on us was he was sitting at a table 20 feet from us just staring into space. When the entrees came out my girlfriends sandwich was missing its onion straws and it had tomatos on it even though she asked for no tomatos. after dinner i wanted to order one of their drink specials (a mojito) but they did not have any mint. My girlfriend went to use the bathroom after dinner and when she came back out she told me there was no toilet paper. This is not the first time i have gone here and received either slow or lackluster service. I highly doubt i will be eating here again.

The server messed up multiple times on a quiet weeknight. No water. Failed to put in order timely. When we complained, the manager comped our apps and any other items we wanted to order. He also let us try some limited beer. And he took the blame for the crappy server's mistakes. He really did the right thing, and quickly too!

I was impressed with both the customer service and food. From entry into restaurant we were greeted by at least 3 employees. We sat and had a very friendly and helpful waitress. The food was very good and filling. And the manager of the restaurant even came to our table to see if everything is ok. Very pleased with this restaurant, will definitely go back. Good job tgif!!!

We were there last night at 6 pm.  The two or three greeters should not speak down to customers.  And why do the greeters seem confused about the table rotation. Not that hard people.  Food mediocre service very good.  The waitress came over enough times and the food took twenty min to come out. Why were we seated in the dark dungeon when the restaurant was empty? Go to Wendy's or Wawa better food and service. We left and the three greeters never noticed while talking among themselves.

I don't know why I continue to return to this establishment... I fear it's because I think that each experience will be better each time ----- but is not !!!  Waited over 35 minutes for our meal  (We ordered : Side salad / baked potato skins w/bacon / steak and Cajun Pasta ) - was hopeful when our server appeared at our table under 5 mins from being seated - she seemed 'seasoned' and what I thought knowledgeable--- sadly she wasn't any better then any of the other staff that works there .  * sighing *  I'm attaching a photo of the pathetic steak / poor presentation of product and as USUAL poor service . At least put some effort in your job -- tsk tsk

Originally I was only going to give 1 star. We ordered a nacho appetizer. It was terrible. There were a couple of beans thrown on it. The cheese was like they took white American sliced cheese and stuck it in a microwave. That was bad enough, but we didn't see the waitress again until after we finished the nachos (we finished them because we were starving). When she finally returned she asked if we were ready to put our order in for our meal. At this point we said just bring the check. The manager came over and asked how everything was. We told him everything that happend and he made it right by comping our meal if we would stay. (We did get charged for the nachos) but that was a fair deal. I ordered the bean and avacado burger.  I have to say it was very good. A bit stingy on the avacado.    I probably would not return only because in general it wasn't the best experience, but I commend the manager. He handled the situation correctly.
We order from grub hub often and all food is always on point and is great with special orders.  No complaints what so ever.    Keep up the good work

Me and da boyz went to TGIF to get ready for Saturday's events. Because Saturday's are for THE BOYZ. Food was undercooked, staff wasn't "peppy" enough to our standards, we hold a high standard FYI. AND THE DRINKS....  Weak. Even the beer was like they poured half out and filled it with water to top it off. But kuddos to Samantha. She was cool and very cute ;p But everyone else.. no.
Service was terrible and the food was less than mediocre. Used to be a decent place but their standards have gone down hill

If you HAVE to do a chain restaurant then do yourself a favor and go up the street to Ruby Tuesdays.  TGI Fridays took 25 mins (for the wrong) drinks.  55 mins to get our orders that were cold and again, wrong.  The waiter himself was nice and apologetic but the restaurant itself really doesn't have its shit together.  Sad

Service was absolutely horrible. After being seated, we waited for 10-15 minutes before we were even noticed. Several servers and bus people passed us without as much as a glance. My husband went to the host and still nothing. Dude that made eye contact with my husband came over, stated he was the general manager and took our drink order. He came back and took our food order. He then brought over a waitress stating "this is my friend.... and she is going to take care of you." After the GM left, she stated that "sorry, this wasn't my table and proceeded to tell us that "Last week, we had a big table in the corner that waited so long that they got up and left." And then, "we're not that busy, but food takes a really long time to get done." She also stated "The host is new, sorry." I was a waitress for a few years. I wouldn't have ever commented on the staff or the food to a customer.  The food wasn't hot, the shrimp tasted hard and cold. Although the appetizer was free, it was less that good. TGIF used to be  our favorite restaurant, but we will never visit the Allentown location again.

We came here as a nostalgia trip. My wife and I have not had TGIF in over 10 years. Parking and access to the restaurant is easy. Upon entering it took a few minutes to be acknowledged and a couple more to be greeted.  Once we were seated the waitress came by and introduced herself (pleasant enough). She disappeared for a while then came back to take our drink order but we also gave her the rest of the order. Came back with water and asked what the third drink we asked for was.... she came back with our appetizer after about 15 minutes. The wait seemed endless and she never stopped by to wonder where our food was. After about 50minutes ! I asked for a supervisor and our entrees were brought out as she left the table. All of the food was dry and it was obvious that it had died in the window. The manager told us that she would leave it incase we wanted to "pick at it" after another 10 minute wait we got the check with the entrees removed.... the whole experience was awful. I wonder how they manage to have 2 stars.

This place is ridiculous. If they aren't messing up orders they are not putting orders in their system at all. I placed an order today, spoke to the same voice I've placed orders with in the past only to be told when I go to pick up my to go order that they never received said order. I was asked if I'm sure I called the right Fridays as if there were more than one Fridays in Allentown. Horrible service, horrible staff. The only thing good at this place is the food, when the order is correct,  that is. Save yourself a headache and go somewhere else.

We have not been to a TGI Fridays in years & years ... happened to find our way there tonight. Very average, nothing special at all as far as good selection, taste or price. Just ok ... wouldn't return.
Catastrophically bad bartenders. Repeatedly cold food. Expensive drinks. I honestly couldn't conceive of a way I could have a worse impression of a restaurant barring being stabbed my the wait staff.

After a rainy day at Dorney Park, we decided to come here for dinner. It ended up being 8 at night, so the restaurant wasn't crowded at all. So, we were seated, looked at the menu, and it probably took the waiter about 15 minutes just to come and take our drink orders, and by that time we already knew what we wanted to eat, so we just ordered the food too while the waiter was there. Both the food and drinks took a long time to come out. The only positive thing about this restaurant is that the food was actually really good and that they have a nice sized parking lot. It was also very cold inside since it was raining and we were all wet, but this TGI Fridays insisted on keeping their air conditioning on, even though most customers were soaked and already cold enough. From now on, I think I'll just stick to the TGI Fridays at the Southmont shopping center in Easton since I've been to that location many times and never had an experience like this there.

I do confess, I've never been a big fan of TGI Fridays. I've eaten in a few different locations around the country and wasn't very impressed. This one is near the hotel we stay in when in Allentown and has been consistently good. Staff turnover must be a major issue, but the service has always been acceptable. The beer is good and cold. The food has never been anything less than excellent. While I generally avoid this chain out in the world, I will return to this location as they have never let me down.

This place has changed over the years, unfortunatley not in a good way.  The dining area and restrooms were clean, and our server was very nice.  However we went in because my wife wanted ribs, and we've had them there before and they are excellent.  They have new ribs theyve been advertising on tv for only 12.99 for a full rack.  We ordered 3 full racks and waited 45 minutes which was odd because it was not busy at all on a tuesday night.  The new ribs were awful, no flavor even when drenched in sauce.  We told our waitress and asked if we can order the old ribs from the menu and she apologized and said all the ribs were that new version now and half her customers since the switch have hated them.  I hope that alarming ratio makes it to the corporate purchasers before its too late.  Won't order that again unless they switch back.  The old ribs were fantastic thats why we went in the first place.

Typically I don't give bad reviews, however it is merited. We waited 50 minutes for the main course and mine was between cold and barely warm. It was not good, dry like it had been reheated. We won't be going back. John's was okay but not worth the wait.

I will just say a few things about Friday's... 1. Probably the most depressing establishment I have been to in a long time. I felt like I was surrounded by zombies. It made me feel sad, and I wasn't sad.  2. We sat at the bar. When we finally attracted the attention of one of the two bartenders working the service bar it felt as if we were putting her out.  3. The floors were dirty...and there was no one there. If you can't be spotless when there is no one there, when can you be clean? 4. The food was, in my husband's words - "not the worst I've ever had, it's edible". Normally his standards are higher than mine. Not this time. I thought it was bad and it took way longer than it should have. We both split the pretzel appetizer. Incredibly buttery. I didn't finish mine and I ALWAYS finish pretzels. I'd eat pretzels until I pop. We also both got the Jack Daniel's burger. First the BBQ sauce was runny with chunks of something or other in it. The burger was unseasoned and at the same time had an odd taste. The bacon was rubbery. The bun stuck to my teeth. I finished less than half. Clearly it was not fresh. The sweet potato fries were the only bright spot. They were yummy.  I will not be back. This is one time where I actually agree with the ratings from fellow Lehigh Valley yelpers. I find they typically give much higher ratings than establishments deserve....2.5 stars is about right for this one.

Lame! How can a restaurant that "specializes" in bar food and appetizers make such lousy wings?   NOT crispy AT ALL.  Not hot, not spicy...just kinda gross. Burger was a 5 out of 10 (fries were old cold and soggy, Pecan Salad was a 6 out of 10. Chicken was probably made elsewhere and reheated locally.  Service...if you can call it that...was a 2 at best.  Hey Veronica...where's my beer? You said you'd be right back!! And another thing...do you always keep the broom and dustpan next to the table we sat at.

Stopped in for early dinner (4pm) with the family. I should have walked out after it took 10 minutes for someone to greet and seat us. The place was empty and it only had a few servers. The server was nice enough but slow going. It took 35 minutes to get our food and my soup was cold. I know better than to send food back. I walked into the restroom and it was filthy. Wish I would have done this first I definitely would have left. How can places like this still be in business? Never again.
